TopicTitle: Blue Danube tune programmed in kOS

Articles.Content:
I started playing around with the kOS mod, and discovered in the documentation it contained a soundchip...

I couldn't help but program the main passage of Strauss' The Blue Danube in kOS and have it play from orbit.

I'm fairly new to KSP, but have been astounded by the community. So many excellent mods and content!

Has anyone else experimented with created tunes using kOS? I found the chip had some peculiarities, (e.g. the more tracks added, the more things became out of sync) and am wondering what other people have created with the chip / thought about it.

I like it.

It's hard to do chords in the SKID chip since each 'voice' is only able to do monophonic notes.   To get a chord you have to make multiple voices have their notes 'align' in time.  I'm impressed you pulled it off.

Fantastic!  I keep meaning to have a look at how to make sounds just to give me alerts when different phases of programmes run (rather than the all to often default beep when they don't run!), but that is freaking awesome!
